headline: Wells Fargo’s FiNet Recruits Financial Advisors From Ameriprise, Raymond James, UBS
summary: Wells Fargo  has scored a passel of recruiting wins this year as it seeks to draw advisors to FiNet, its independent wealth management channel.  The largest practice, Houser, Plessl & Staples Wealth Management, based in Allentown, Pa., has joined FiNet from  Ameriprise  where the team managed more than $530 million in client assets.  The same day, advisor Paolo Thompson joined Merritt Point Advisors, a FiNet practice, from Raymond James, where he managed more than $400 million in assets.

headline: Truist and Evercore Lower Wells Fargo (WFC) Price Targets, Stay Bullish
summary: Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) is one of the 11 Most Profitable Cheap Stocks to Invest In Now. headline: Are Wall Street Analysts Predicting Wells Fargo Stock Will Climb or Sink?
summary: Wells Fargo has lagged behind the broader market over the past year, yet analysts remain moderately optimistic about the stock’s prospects.

headline: Jim Cramer Recommends Well Fargo for Its AI Potential
summary: Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer discussed, along with market shortages. headline: Wells Fargo Cuts Proxy Adviser Ties in Latest Blow to Industry
summary: The bank will make voting decisions on shareholder proposals without the help of proxy advisers like ISS and instead rely on a new internal system.
